extendedIngredients.name: canned tomato sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2-8 oz cans of organic tomato sauce

extendedIngredients.name: green bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 green pepper, cut into strips and sauteed

extendedIngredients.name: onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small onion, cut into strips and sauteed

recipes.title: Chicken Fajita Rolls (Low Carb and Paleo)

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken can be paired with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions:
Preheat oven to 425 F.

Cut the eggplant into strips 1/4" thick (I used the smallest thickness of my mandolin).

Sprinkle the eggplant strips with salt and let sit for 30 minutes.

Heat 1 Tbsp of oil over medium-high heat and cook the eggplant for 2-3 minutes per side and lay out on paper towel to drain.

Mix the chicken, onions, and green peppers with 3/4 cup of taco sauce.

Place a spoonful of chicken mixture onto one end of an eggplant strip and roll the eggplant from one end to the other.

Repeat with the remaining eggplant strips.

Place the rolled eggplant in a casserole dish and top with 3/4 cup of taco sauce.

(Optional) Top with shredded cheese.

Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

steps.step: Cut the eggplant into strips 1/4" thick (I used the smallest thickness of my mandolin).Sprinkle the eggplant strips with salt and let sit for 30 minutes.
Heat 1 Tbsp of oil over medium-high heat and cook the eggplant for 2-3 minutes per side and lay out on paper towel to drain.
Mix the chicken, onions, and green peppers with 3/4 cup of taco sauce.
Place a spoonful of chicken mixture onto one end of an eggplant strip and roll the eggplant from one end to the other. Repeat with the remaining eggplant strips.
Place the rolled eggplant in a casserole dish and top with 3/4 cup of taco sauce.  (Optional) Top with shredded cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
